page.title: 13FARMING IN DATCHWORTH
page.content: {TYPES OF FARMS} There has been farming in and around Datchworth for over 900 years. The soil in this area is clay based and this has given rise to a mixture of different land uses for farming. There are 3 main farms in this area: 1) Bury Farm - Wheat,Barley,Rape Oil Seed, small herd of beef cattle. 2)Coltsfoot Farm - Peas,Corn,Wheat,Barley. 3) Hawkins Hall Farm - Shetland Horses and Ponies. {BURY FARM} This is the biggest farm being 218 hectares in size. It is over 300 years old. The present family have been farming it for 72 years. The farmer employs 2 full time workers. His main worries are vandalism to machinery and over production of crops. He also thinks that he will be producing more vegetables in the future.
